title: 103_hr3375
content: SEC. 101 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended to include a new part X for Safe Schools Assistance. The Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, may provide grants to local educational agencies affected by crime and violence. A safe schools model will be developed and made available to interested agencies. The Director will provide grants for anticrime measures, education programs, counseling for crime victims in schools, crime prevention equipment, and reducing youth involvement in organized crime and drug activities in schools. Applications for grants can be made under Section 2403. To be eligible for a grant under this part, a local educational agency must submit an application to the Director with specific information. The application must include a funding request for designated purposes, details about the schools and communities to be served, assurances on fund usage, and statistical data on crime. The application for a grant under this part must include a comprehensive plan addressing crime problems in targeted schools, projects to be developed, available community resources, gaps in the plan, how the grant will be used, crime prevention system, and educational materials in Spanish. The Director can use up to 5% of funds for administration and technical assistance. Grants can be renewed for up to 2 additional years if funds were used as required and if additional funding is needed for crime prevention programs. The Director, in consultation with the Secretary of Education, considers factors like the crime problem, demonstrated need, and student population when awarding grants to local educational agencies. The Director aims for an equitable geographic distribution of grant awards. Reports are required as per Section 2406. Local educational agencies receiving funds under this part must submit an annual progress report to the Director by March 1. The Director is required to submit a detailed report to Congress by October 1 each year, detailing grant awards, recipient activities, statistical information, and program evaluations. Definitions are provided in Section 2407. The term 'Director' refers to the Director of the Bureau of Justice Assistance, and 'local educational agency' refers to a public board of education or other public authority within a State for administrative control of public schools. The table of contents of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968 is amended by striking part X and inserting new content. Sec. 2402 of the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act authorizes $100,000,000 for each fiscal year from 1994 to 1996 for projects under part X.
